intro: Oenothera kuntziana, commonly known as the Kuntz's evening primrose, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Onagraceae family and is characterized by its showy, yellow-orange flowers that open in the evening. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its flowers have four petals and are pollinated primarily by moths and other nocturnal insects. Oenothera kuntziana is also known for its medicinal properties, with its seeds containing high levels of essential fatty acids.
